alert.note: Alert for Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 20 at 12:45AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Potential for high water due to snowmelt. * WHERE...Porcupine River from the border to Fort Yukon * WHEN...Through Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...High water along the entire length of the Porcupine River is now causing minor flooding of low-lying and flood-prone locations along the Porcupine River. Residents at Fort Yukon report that minor flooding is occuring near the Porcupine River with one home cutoff by water, and that water continues to rise. Additionally, minor flooding is occuring in some low lying areas of Fort Yukon near the airport and water is rising slowly there. If water continues to rise it could impact the runway at Fort Yukon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Warming temperatures are causing rapid snowmelt in the Eastern Brooks Range and sending a large volume of water into the Porcupine River. Warm temperatures continuing over the weekend will likely increase the snowmelt, and cause the already high water on the Porcupine River to rise slowly this weekend. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood - If you live near or along the Porcupine River stay alert and be prepared to take action.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
